Package edu.vserver.exercises.model

This package contains all the interfaces defining interaction between ViLLE-system and a ViLLE-exercise type.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Editor<E extends ExerciseData> An implementor of this class knows how to edit and create ExerciseData suitable for parameterizing exercise instances for certain exercise-type.
EditorMaterialManager This interface represents an abstract interface through which the Editor implementors delete, add and save file-materials that can be used in the exercises.
ExecutionSettings Implementor of this interface tells what kind of feedback can be shown to the user during certain execution of an exercise.
ExecutionState An implementor holds information about the current state of certain exercise.
ExecutionStateChangeListener Implementors of this interface registered through #registerExecutionStateChangeListener(ExecutionStateChangeListener) -method are called with a new ExecutionState instance whenever the state of the executor changes.
Executor<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo> An implementor of this class knows how to execute certain exercise-instance defined by certain ExerciseData of given exercise-type.
ExerciseData Implementing this interface identifies the implementing class as an exercise- type specific data-class.
ExerciseMaterial Represents a certain file containing a Material for certain Exercise that is stored with certain id.
ExerciseMaterialManager This interface represents an abstract interface through which the Executor can fetch materials attached to certain ExerciseData -instance.
ExerciseSaveListener<E extends ExerciseData> Implementors of this interface registered through #registerSaveListener(ExerciseSaveListener) are called with a new ExerciseData instance when a user prompts the editor to save the data
ExerciseTypeDescriptor<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo> Class that binds together information of certain exercise-type that is needed for using the type.
ExerciseXMLHandler<E extends ExerciseData> An implementor can write a matching ExerciseData-object to a stream in predetermined (preferably) XML-format, and can also read an ExerciseData-object from a (correctly formed) stream.
GeneralExerciseInfo A class containing general info of the exercise-instance under edit.
GeneralExerciseInfoEditor An implementor of this allows user to edit general-info (not exercise-type specific) about exercise-instances for example the name and description of the exercise-instance shown to students.
ResourceGiver Implementors of this class provide localization and certain resourcse to the current session.
SubmissionInfo Implementing this interface identifies the implementing class as an exercise type specific submisssion info class.
SubmissionListener<S extends SubmissionInfo> Implementors of this interface registered through #registerSubmitListener(SubmissionListener) -method are called with a new SubmissionFeedback instance whenever a new submission is made through the Executor the listener is registered to.
SubmissionStatisticsGiver<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo> An implementor of this class knows how to derive interesting statistical info of submissions made to certain exercise.
SubmissionType Type of certain submission.
SubmissionVisualizer<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo> An implementor of this class knows how to visualize certain submission stored as SubmissionInfo made to a given exercise (ExerciseData ).
 

Class Summary
StatisticalSubmissionInfo<S extends SubmissionInfo> This class wraps an SubmissionInfo-implementor and some generic info on the submission.
SubmissionFeedback<S extends SubmissionInfo> This class encapsulates needed information about a submission made to a certain exercise.
 

Enum Summary
ExerciseException.ErrorType Categories to which most ExerciseExceptions fall into.
 

Exception Summary
ExerciseException Only checked Exception that can be thrown from interfaces of edu.vserver.exercises.model.
 

Package edu.vserver.exercises.model Description

This package contains all the interfaces defining interaction between ViLLE-system and a ViLLE-exercise type.
